page.title: 15Architectural Features
page.content: The Town Hall was built in 1871 and cost Â£2,500 and was opened by William the 7th Duke of Devonshire. The tower was added in 1875. An extension was added to the hall in 1898 to 1899 at a cost of Â£1,750 and a new wing in 1900 cost Â£1,800. A free library was established in the Town Hall in 1895 costing Â£500 in what is now the Council Chamber. The present free library was built adjoining the Town Hall on Hall Street in 1909 at a cost of Â£2,000. High Lea Hall and its grounds, formerly the residence of various factory owners in the town was purchased for use as a public park in 1937 for Â£2,352.
